hero.title: KSA Flag Football
hero.subtitle: Flag football is more than just a sport—it's a fast-growing, inclusive game that connects communities. As an official Olympic sport debuting at LA 2028, flag football is taking the world by storm. KSA Flag Football is dedicated to growing the game across the Kingdom, giving everyone the opportunity to play, compete, and be part of something extraordinary.
hero.modalDescription: KSA Flag Football is growing the sport across Saudi Arabia. Whether you're a complete beginner or an experienced player, everyone is welcome.
hero.modalPractice: We hold weekly practices in Jeddah — come try it out!

community.title: Join Our Community
community.description: Join KSA Flag Football (KSAFF) and connect with a dynamic community dedicated to flag football excellence in Saudi Arabia. Whether you're a player, team manager, coach, referee, or fan, KSAFF provides a comprehensive platform for growth, competition, and active participation in the fastest-growing sport heading to the Olympics.

teamsPage.title: Our Teams
teamsPage.description: Meet the clubs competing across the Kingdom and beyond. KSAFF is building a thriving flag football community.
teamsPage.clubDescription: Our club teams form the backbone of the KSAFF community, competing in local leagues and international tournaments across the region.
teamsPage.womensTeamDescription: The first women's flag football team in Saudi Arabia — breaking barriers and pioneering the sport across the Kingdom.

alBahara.name: Al Bahara
alBahara.description: Based in Jeddah, Al Bahara is one of the most active teams in the KSAFF community. They have competed in tournaments across the region, representing Saudi flag football in Abu Dhabi, Dubai, and Jeddah — building experience and bringing home invaluable international exposure.

cheetahs.name: Cheetahs
cheetahs.description: The Cheetahs made history by winning the tournament in Barcelona, proving that Saudi flag football talent can compete and triumph on the international stage. Their championship run was a defining moment for the KSAFF community.

tournaments.title: Tournaments
tournaments.description: KSAFF hosts tournaments for men and women, showcasing flag football talent across the Kingdom. These competitions build skills at every level and prepare athletes for regional and international events, including the road to the 2028 Olympics.
tournaments.season2025Description: Our 2025 season saw KSAFF expand across the region with tournaments in Abu Dhabi, Barcelona, and Dubai, plus a summer league in Saudi Arabia in partnership with Bridgeway Sports.

abuDhabi.title: Abu Dhabi Tournament
abuDhabi.description: Kicking off the 2025 season with a competitive tournament in Abu Dhabi.

barcelona.title: Barcelona Tournament
barcelona.description: KSAFF took the game international with a tournament in Barcelona.

summerLeague.title: Summer League — Riyadh & Jeddah
summerLeague.description: A summer league across Riyadh and Jeddah in partnership with Bridgeway Sports.

kaust.title: KAUST Summer Tournament
kaust.description: The summer league culminated with a tournament at KAUST to close out the season.

dubai.title: Dubai Tournament
dubai.description: Wrapping up 2025 with a year-end tournament in Dubai.

about.title: About KSA Flag Football
about.introP1: Flag football is a non-contact, 5-on-5 variation of American football where the defensive team must pull a flag from the ball carrier's belt to end the play. It's fast, strategic, and accessible — open to men and women of all ages and athletic backgrounds. With its inclusion as an official sport in the 2028 Olympic Games in Los Angeles, flag football is one of the fastest-growing sports in the world.
about.introP2: KSA Flag Football (KSAFF) has grown into a community of over 130 players across 14 teams in 3 regions — the Western Region (Jeddah, ~60 players across 6 teams), the Central Region (Riyadh, ~50 players across 6 teams), and the Eastern Region (Dammam & Dhahran, ~20 players across 2 teams). Our players range from ages 16 to 45+ and represent over 10 nationalities, making KSAFF one of the most diverse sporting communities in the Kingdom.
about.introP3: From weekly practices and local leagues to international tournaments in Abu Dhabi, Barcelona, Cairo, and Dubai, KSAFF is building a complete flag football ecosystem — including the first women's team in Saudi Arabia, established in 2025 in collaboration with TeamUp Academy.
about.highlight1: A fast-paced, team-based 5v5 format played on a smaller field — designed for speed, agility, and strategy.
about.highlight2: Emphasizes skill and tactical intelligence over physical size, making it accessible to a wide range of athletes.
about.highlight3: One of the fastest-growing sports globally, now an official Olympic sport debuting at the 2028 Los Angeles Games.
about.highlight4: An inclusive, non-contact sport open to all ages and genders — perfect for grassroots development.
about.highlight5: Rapidly expanding across the Middle East and Saudi Arabia, with KSAFF leading the charge in the Kingdom.
about.olympicsDescription: Flag football will make its Olympic debut at the 2028 Los Angeles Games. KSAFF is preparing Saudi athletes to compete at the highest level, with a clear roadmap for national team development and international qualification.
about.obj1: Achieve official recognition from the Saudi Arabian Olympic Committee and establish KSAFF as the national governing body for flag football.
about.obj2: Build an integrated ecosystem of leagues, coaching programs, and referee development to raise the level of competition across the Kingdom.
about.obj3: Secure full membership in IFAF (International Federation of American Football) and participate in continental and world championship events.
about.journeyOverview: What started in 2012 with a single American football team in Jeddah has grown into a nationwide movement. Over more than a decade, KSAFF has expanded from local pickup games to organized leagues, international tournaments, and the first women's team in the Kingdom — all building toward the 2028 Olympic Games.

journey.j2012: Establishing the first American Football team in KSA — the Jeddah Jaws.
journey.j2013: Jeddah Jaws competing in the first American Football game in Kuwait.
journey.j2014: Organizing the first Flag Football tournament in Jeddah, KSA.
journey.j2016: Representing Saudi Arabia in the IFAF Flag Football Asian Cup in Vietnam.
journey.j2019: Organizing the first annual Ramadan Flag Football tournament in Jeddah, KSA.
journey.j2023: Participating in the Xflag Tournament in Dubai, UAE.
journey.j2024a: Participating in the Oasis Flag Football Cup in Abu Dhabi, UAE.
journey.j2024b: Participating in the Play Flag Football UAE tournament in Dubai, UAE.
journey.j2024c: Establishing the first Saudi Flag Football League with 8 teams between Jeddah, KAEC, KAUST, and Riyadh.
journey.j2025a: Participating in the ANFC Flag Football Cup in Cairo, Egypt.
journey.j2025b: Establishing the first Women's Flag Football team in Jeddah, KSA.
journey.j2025c: First place in the Masters World Bowl tournament in Barcelona, Spain.
journey.j2025d: Participating in the Dubai Bowl Tournament in Dubai, UAE.

tournamentsPage.achievementsDescription: A track record of competing on the regional and international stage — bringing Saudi flag football talent to the world.

barcelona.title: Masters World Bowl — Barcelona, Spain
barcelona.description: KSAFF competed in the Masters World Bowl in Barcelona, taking home the championship title in a historic first-place finish on the international stage.

oasis.title: Oasis Cup — Abu Dhabi, UAE
oasis.description: KSAFF teams competed in the Oasis Flag Football Cup in Abu Dhabi, earning a third-place finish against regional competition.

bridgeway.title: Bridgeway Flag Football League
bridgeway.description: A competitive league organized in partnership with Bridgeway Sports, spanning Jeddah and Riyadh with multiple teams from across the Kingdom.

ramadan.title: Annual Ramadan Tournament
ramadan.description: An annual tradition bringing the flag football community together during Ramadan in Jeddah, running consecutively since 2022.

womensTeam.title: First Women's Team in KSA
womensTeam.description: Establishing the first women's flag football team in the Kingdom, in collaboration with TeamUp Academy — a landmark moment for the sport in Saudi Arabia.

everyBody.title: Every Body Counts
everyBody.description: Be part of Saudi Arabia's flag football journey! We are building a vibrant community that nurtures the sport from grassroots to elite levels, embracing inclusivity, fostering competitiveness, and developing world-class programs. Flag football is for everyone—no matter your age, gender, or experience level. Join us in growing the game across the Kingdom.

media.title: Media
media.description: Highlights from our tournaments, practices, and community events across Saudi Arabia and beyond.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.description: Want to play flag football, join a team, or learn more about KSAFF? We'd love to hear from you.
contact.practice: Every week in Jeddah — all levels welcome

calendar.title: 2026 Season Calendar
calendar.description: A year at a glance — tournaments, leagues, and events planned for the 2026 season across Saudi Arabia and the region.
calendar.note: Dates and events are subject to change. Follow us on Instagram @flagfootballksa for updates.

events.maySummerLeague: Summer League kicks off — Riyadh & Jeddah

blog.title: Latest News & Articles
blog.post1Title: KSA Flag Football Stars Shine at IFAF Asia Championship
blog.post1Excerpt: The Saudi flag football team delivered a stunning performance at the IFAF Asia Continental Championship, advancing to the semi-finals in a historic achievement.
blog.post2Title: Fanatics Flag Football Classic Coming to Riyadh
blog.post2Excerpt: Tom Brady headlines an all-star flag football tournament at Kingdom Arena in Riyadh on March 21, 2026, featuring NFL legends in a round-robin format.
blog.post3Excerpt: KSAFF has released the official 2026 competition calendar, featuring expanded leagues and Olympic qualification events.

womensTeam.title: Women's National Team
womensTeam.subtitle: Pioneering women's flag football in Saudi Arabia
womensTeam.storyTitle: The First Women's Flag Football Team in Saudi Arabia
womensTeam.storyP1: The KSAFF Women's National Team represents a historic milestone — the first women's flag football team in Saudi Arabia. Breaking barriers and challenging expectations, these athletes are paving the way for women in sport across the Kingdom.
womensTeam.storyP2: With dedication, skill, and an unwavering competitive spirit, the team is building a legacy that inspires the next generation of female athletes in Saudi Arabia and the region. Their journey is a testament to what's possible when passion meets opportunity.

collaborators.title: Our Collaborators and Partners
collaborators.description: We are proud to work with organizations that share our vision of growing flag football across Saudi Arabia and beyond.
collaborators.kaecDescription: KAEC has been a key partner in supporting flag football events and providing world-class facilities for our tournaments and training camps.
collaborators.teamupDescription: TeamUp Sports collaborates with KSAFF to organize tournaments and grow the flag football community across the region.
collaborators.bridgewayDescription: Bridgeway Sports partners with KSAFF to run our summer leagues in Riyadh and Jeddah, helping bring competitive flag football to more cities.
collaborators.buffaloDescription: Buffalo Wings & Rings supports KSAFF events and tournaments, fueling our athletes and community gatherings.
collaborators.sportsForAllDescription: The Sports for All Federation works with KSAFF to promote flag football as an inclusive, accessible sport for everyone in the Kingdom.
collaborators.ambitiousDescription: Ambitious partners with KSAFF to bring creative marketing and brand development to flag football in Saudi Arabia.

footer.tagline: Follow us on our social platforms to stay updated with KSA Flag Football!
